objects.name: National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC)
objects.description: Publisher and author of this malware analysis report; also authors of the included detection rules.

objects.name: SparrowDoor proxy IP
objects.description: Proxy IP provided in SparrowDoor configuration; used if direct connection fails.

objects.name: SparrowDoor mutex
objects.description: Mutex created by SparrowDoor to ensure single instance execution on a host.

objects.name: Indicator for libcurl.dll MD5 (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 of SparrowDoor 32-bit loader libcurl.dll.

objects.name: Indicator for libcurl.dll SHA-1 (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 of SparrowDoor 32-bit loader libcurl.dll.

objects.name: Indicator for libcurl.dll SHA-256 (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 of SparrowDoor 32-bit loader libcurl.dll.

objects.name: Indicator for libhost.dll MD5 (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 of SparrowDoor backdoor libhost.dll.

objects.name: Indicator for libhost.dll SHA-1 (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 of SparrowDoor backdoor libhost.dll.

objects.name: Indicator for libhost.dll SHA-256 (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 of SparrowDoor backdoor libhost.dll.

objects.name: Indicator for SearchIndexer.exe MD5 (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 of legitimate Notepad++ updater renamed to SearchIndexer.exe and used to load SparrowDoor.

objects.name: Indicator for SearchIndexer.exe SHA-1 (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 of legitimate Notepad++ updater renamed to SearchIndexer.exe and used to load SparrowDoor.

objects.name: Indicator for SearchIndexer.exe SHA-256 (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 of legitimate Notepad++ updater renamed to SearchIndexer.exe and used to load SparrowDoor.

objects.name: sparrowdoor
objects.description: SparrowDoor is a persistent 32-bit Windows loader and backdoor found on a UK network in 2021. It side-loads a malicious libcurl.dll via a signed Notepad++ updater renamed to SearchIndexer.exe, patches the target process WinMain with a long jump, and reflectively loads an obfuscated backdoor contained in libhost.dll. The malware evades defenses through DLL side-loading, process injection into a suspended svchost.exe, API inline hooks (e.g., AcquireCredentialsHandleA, ws2_32 shutdown and closesocket), token impersonation to use a low-privilege explorer.exe token, masquerading with legitimate names, and XOR obfuscation of its configuration and C2 traffic. It maintains persistence by creating a Windows service (SearchIndexer) or using the CurrentVersion\Run registry key. Communications occur over HTTPS, optionally via a proxy, with beacon intervals that vary and data encoded using static XOR keys. Tasking supports file and directory operations, file deletion and cleanup, reverse shell, and clipboard logging (“clipshot”). The malware stores component paths in environment variables (111, 222, 333), creates a mutex (Global\gup0), and implements reflective code loading and anti-analysis features (no PE headers for the backdoor payload).

objects.name: Create or Modify System Process: Windows Service
objects.description: SparrowDoor achieves persistence by installing SearchIndexer.exe as a Windows service, using parameters defined in the malware configuration.

objects.name: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
objects.description: If SparrowDoor fails to persist as a Windows Service, it installs SearchIndexer.exe in the CurrentVersion\Run key.

objects.name: Access Token Manipulation: Token Impersonation/Theft
objects.description: SparrowDoor impersonates the user account token associated with the explorer.exe process.

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: The SparrowDoor malware file libhost.dll is obfuscated with a 4-byte XOR key and the configuration is obfuscated with an 8-byte XOR key.

objects.name: Hijack Execution Flow: DLL Side-Loading
objects.description: The SparrowDoor malware gains execution when the malware file libcurl.dll is side-loaded by SearchIndexer.exe.

objects.name: Process Injection: Portable Executable Injection
objects.description: SparrowDoor injects itself into a spawned and suspended instance of svchost.exe during initialisation.

objects.name: Indicator Removal on Host: File Deletion
objects.description: SparrowDoor can be tasked to remove arbitrary files from the host. It can also be tasked to delete files specific to the malware execution i.e. a clean-up routine.

objects.name: Reflective Code Loading
objects.description: SparrowDoor is loaded by a reflective loader found in libhost.dll.

objects.name: Masquerading: Match Legitimate Name or Location
objects.description: A legitimate and signed Notepad++ updater has been renamed SearchIndexer.exe, which is the name of a legitimate Windows binary. This file is used to load SparrowDoor. The malware also uses the name libcurl.dll for its loader, libcurl is a legitimate project.

objects.name: Signed Binary Proxy Execution
objects.description: SparrowDoor is side-loaded into, and hijacks execution of, a signed Notepad++ updater.

objects.name: Software Discovery: Security Software Discovery
objects.description: SparrowDoor checks the running processes against a list of hardcoded AV names.

objects.name: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols
objects.description: SparrowDoor uses HTTPS as a Command and control (C2) channel and is proxy aware.

objects.name: Encrypted Channel: Symmetric Cryptography
objects.description: SparrowDoor uses static XOR keys to encode data when it is being sent or received over the C2 channel.

objects.name: Clipboard Data
objects.description: SparrowDoor can be tasked to launch clipboard logging functionality.

objects.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
objects.description: SparrowDoor can be tasked to exfiltrate files from disk.

objects.name: ESET
objects.description: Security vendor referenced as having reported SparrowDoor in September 2021.

objects.name: 360.cn (Qihoo 360)
objects.description: Antivirus vendor referenced in the AV process check list (ZhuDongFangYu.exe).

objects.name: Kaspersky
objects.description: Antivirus vendor referenced in the AV process check list (avp.exe).

objects.name: Symantec
objects.description: Antivirus vendor referenced in the AV process check list (ccSetMgr.exe, ccSvcHst.exe, ccapp.exe).

objects.name: Trend Micro
objects.description: Antivirus vendor referenced in the AV process check list (TMBMSRV.exe).

objects.name: Comodo
objects.description: Security vendor referenced in the AV process check list (Comodo Firewall Pro, cpf.exe).

objects.name: McAfee
objects.description: Antivirus vendor referenced in the AV process check list (Mcshield.exe).

objects.name: SparrowDoor_apipatch
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_apipatch {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"

  description = "Identifies code segments in SparrowDoor
responsible for patching APIs. No MZ/PE match as the backdoor has no
header. Targeting in memory."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "c1890a6447c991880467b86a013dbeaa66cc615f"
    strings:
        $save = {8B 06 89 07 8A 4E 04} // save off first 5 bytes of
function

  $vp_1 = {89 10 8A 4E 04 8B D6 2B D0 88 48 04 83 EA 05 C6 40 05 E9

89 50 06} // calculate long jump

  $vp_2 = {50 8B D6 6A 40 2B D7 88 4F 04 83 EA 05 6A 05 C6 47 05 E9

89 57 06 56} // calculate long jump 2

  $vp_3 = {51 52 2B DE 6A 05 83 EB 05 56 C6 06 E9 89 5E 01} //

restore memory protections

  $va = {6A 40 68 00 10 00 00 68 00 10 00 00 6A 00} // virtually

alloc set size, allocation and protection

  $s_patch = {50 68 7F FF FF FF 68 FF FF 00 00 56} // socket patch

SO_DONTLINGER

    condition:

    3 of them

}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_clipshot
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
import "pe"
rule SparrowDoor_clipshot {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"

  description = "The SparrowDoor loader contains a feature it calls

clipshot, which logs clipboard data to a file."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "989b3798841d06e286eb083132242749c80fdd4d"
    strings:
        $exsting_cmp = {8B 1E 3B 19 75 ?? 83 E8 04 83 C1 04 83 C6 04 83
F8 04} // comparison routine for previous clipboard data

  $time_format_string = "%d/%d/%d %d:%d" ascii
  $cre_fil_args = {6A 00 68 80 00 00 00 6A 04 6A 00 6A 02 68 00 00

00 40 52}
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them and (pe.imports("User32.dll","OpenClipboard") and
pe.imports("User32.dll","GetClipboardData") and
pe.imports("Kernel32.dll","GetLocalTime") and
pe.imports("Kernel32.dll","GlobalSize"))

}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_config
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_config {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"

  description = "Targets the XOR encoded loader config and
shellcode in the file libhost.dll using the known position of the XOR
key."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "c1890a6447c991880467b86a013dbeaa66cc615f"
    condition:
        (uint16(0) != 0x5A4D) and
        (uint16(0) != 0x8b55) and

  (uint32(0) ^ uint32(0x4c) ==  0x00) and
  (uint32(0) ^ uint32(0x34) ==  0x00) and
  (uint16(0) ^ uint16(0x50) ==  0x8b55)

}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_loader
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_loader {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"

  description = "Targets code features of the SparrowDoor loader.

This rule detects the previous variant and this new variant."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "989b3798841d06e286eb083132242749c80fdd4d"
    strings:

  $xor_algo = {8B D0 83 E2 03 8A 54 14 10 30 14 30 40 3B C1}
  $rva = {8D B0 [4] 8D 44 24 ?? 50 6A 40 6A 05 56} // load RVA of

process exe
        $lj = {2B CE 83 E9 05 8D [3] 52 C6 06 E9 89 4E 01 8B [3] 50 6A 05
56} // calculate long jump
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them

}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_shellcode
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: SparrowDoor_sleep_routine
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_sleep_routine {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "SparrowDoor implements a Sleep routine with value
seeded on GetTickCount. This signature detects the previous and this
variant of SparrowDoor. No MZ/PE match as the backdoor has no header.
Targeting in memory."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "c1890a6447c991880467b86a013dbeaa66cc615f"

    strings:
        $sleep = {FF D7 33 D2 B9 [4] F7 F1 81 C2 [4] 8B C2 C1 E0 04 2B C2
03 C0 03 C0 03 C0 50}

    condition:

  all of them

}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_xor
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_xor {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"

  description = "Highlights XOR routines in SparrowDoor. No MZ/PE

match as the backdoor has no header. Targeting in memory."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "c1890a6447c991880467b86a013dbeaa66cc615f"
    strings:
        $xor_routine_outbound = {B8 39 8E E3 38 F7 E1 D1 EA 8D 14 D2 8B
C1 2B C2 8A [4] 00 30 14 39 41 3B CE}

  $xor_routine_inbound = {B8 25 49 92 24 F7 E1 8B C1 2B C2 D1 E8 03

C2 C1 E8 02 8D 14 C5 [4] 2B D0 8B C1 2B C2}
        $xor_routine_config = {8B D9 83 E3 07 0F [6] 30 18 8D 1C 07 83 E3
07 0F [6] 30 58 01 8D 1C 28 83 E3 07 0F [6] 30 58 02 8D 1C 02 83 E3 07 0F
[6] 30 58 03 8B DE 83 E3 07 0F [6] 30 58 04 83 C6 05 83 C1 05}
    condition:
        2 of them
}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_strings {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Strings that appear in SparrowDoor's backdoor.
Targeting in memory."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "c1890a6447c991880467b86a013dbeaa66cc615f"

    strings:
        $reg = "Software\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\Run" ascii

$http_headers = {55 73 65 72 2D 41 67 65 6E 74 3A 20 4D 6F 7A 69 6C

6C 61 2F 34 2E 30 20 28 63 6F 6D 70 61 74 69 62 6C 65 3B 20 4D 53 49 45
20 35 2E 30 3B 20 57 69 6E 64 6F 77 73 20 4E 54 20 35 2E 30 29 0D 0A 41
63 63 65 70 74 2D 4C 61 6E 67 75 61 67 65 3A 20 65 6E 2D 55 53 0D 0A 41
63 63 65 70 74 3A 20 2A 2F 2A 0D 0A}

$http_proxy = "HTTPS=HTTPS://%s:%d" ascii
$debug = "SeDebugPrivilege" ascii
$av1 = "avp.exe" ascii // Kaspersky
$av2 = "ZhuDongFangYu.exe" ascii // Qihoo360
$av3 = "egui.exe" ascii // ESET
$av4 = "TMBMSRV.exe" ascii // Trend Micro
$av5 = "ccSetMgr.exe" ascii // Norton
$clipshot = "clipshot" ascii
$ComSpec =  "ComSpec" ascii
$export = "curl_easy_init" ascii

    condition:
        10 of them
}

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Sparrowdoor
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. sparrowdoor.
